Package net.minestom.server.entity

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.entity.Entity
      • net.minestom.server.entity.LivingEntity
        • net.minestom.server.entity.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Audience, Identified, HoverEventSource<HoverEvent.ShowEntity>, Localizable, CommandSender, DataContainer, EventHandler, IExtensionObserver, EquipmentHandler, PermissionHandler, Viewable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FakePlayer
    public class Player
extends LivingEntity
implements CommandSender, Localizable, HoverEventSource<HoverEvent.ShowEntity>, Identified
    Those are the major actors of the server, they are not necessary backed by a NettyPlayerConnection as shown by FakePlayer.

    You can easily create your own implementation of this and use it with ConnectionManager.setPlayerProvider(PlayerProvider).

      • UNSAFE_init

        public void UNSAFE_init​(@NotNull
                        @NotNull Instance spawnInstance)
        Used when the player is created. Init the player and spawn him.

        WARNING: executed in the main update thread UNSAFE: Only meant to be used when a netty player connects through the server.

        Parameters:
        spawnInstance - the player spawn instance (defined in PlayerLoginEvent)

      • respawn

        public void respawn()
        Respawns the player by sending a RespawnPacket to the player and teleporting him to getRespawnPoint(). It also resets fire and health.

      • sendPacketToViewersAndSelf

        public void sendPacketToViewersAndSelf​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull ServerPacket packet)
        Description copied from interface: Viewable
        Sends a packet to all viewers and the viewable element if it is a player.

        If 'this' isn't a player, then only Viewable.sendPacketToViewers(ServerPacket) is called.

        Specified by:
        sendPacketToViewersAndSelf in interface Viewable
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to send

      • setInstance

        public void setInstance​(@NotNull
                        @NotNull Instance instance,
                        @NotNull
                        @NotNull Position spawnPosition)
        Changes the player instance and load surrounding chunks if needed.

        Be aware that because chunk operations are expensive, it is possible for this method to be non-blocking when retrieving chunks is required.

        Overrides:
        setInstance in class Entity
        Parameters:
        instance - the new player instance
        spawnPosition - the new position of the player

      • refreshVisibleChunks

        public void refreshVisibleChunks​(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull Chunk newChunk)
        Called when the player changes chunk (move from one to another). Can also be used to refresh the list of chunks that the client should see based on getChunkRange().

        It does remove and add the player from the chunks viewers list when removed or added. It also calls the events PlayerChunkUnloadEvent and PlayerChunkLoadEvent.

        Parameters:
        newChunk - the current/new player chunk (can be the current one)

      • refreshVisibleChunks

      • refreshVisibleEntities

                                   @NotNull Chunk newChunk)

        Parameters:
        newChunk - the new chunk of the player (can be the current one)

      • teleport

        public void teleport​(@NotNull
                     @NotNull Position position,
                     @Nullable
                     @org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable long[] chunks,
                     @Nullable
                     @Nullable Runnable callback)
        Description copied from class: Entity
        Teleports the entity only if the chunk at position is loaded or if Instance.hasEnabledAutoChunkLoad() returns true.
        Overrides:
        teleport in class Entity
        Parameters:
        position - the teleport position
        chunks - the chunk indexes to load before teleporting the entity, indexes are from ChunkUtils.getChunkIndex(int, int), can be null or empty to only load the chunk at position
        callback - the optional callback executed, even if auto chunk is not enabled

      • addPacketToQueue

        public void addPacketToQueue​(@NotNull
                             @NotNull ClientPlayPacket packet)
        All packets in the queue are executed in the update(long) method It is used internally to add all received packet from the client. Could be used to "simulate" a received packet, but to use at your own risk.
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet to add in the queue

      • refreshKeepAlive

        public void refreshKeepAlive​(long lastKeepAlive)
        Used to change internally the last sent last keep alive id.

        Warning: could lead to have the player kicked because of a wrong keep alive packet.

        Parameters:
        lastKeepAlive - the new lastKeepAlive id

      • refreshHeldSlot

        public void refreshHeldSlot​(byte slot)
        Changes the held item for the player viewers Also cancel eating if isEating() was true.

        Warning: the player will not be noticed by this chance, only his viewers, see instead: setHeldItemSlot(byte).

        Parameters:
        slot - the new held slot

      • setTargetBlock

                           @NotNull CustomBlock targetCustomBlock,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull BlockPosition targetBlockPosition,
                           @Nullable
                           @Nullable Set<Player> breakers)
        Makes the player digging a custom block, see resetTargetBlock() to rewind.
        Parameters:
        targetCustomBlock - the custom block to dig
        targetBlockPosition - the custom block position
        breakers - the breakers of the block, can be null if this is the only breaker

      • resetTargetBlock

        public void resetTargetBlock()
        Resets data from the current block the player is mining. If the currently mined block (or if there isn't any) is not a CustomBlock, nothing happen.

      • showPlayer

        protected void showPlayer​(@NotNull
                          @NotNull PlayerConnection connection)
        Sends all the related packet to have the player sent to another with related data (create player, spawn position, velocity, metadata, equipments, passengers, team).

        WARNING: this alone does not sync the player, please use Entity.addViewer(Player).

        Parameters:
        connection - the connection to show the player to
